resources.name: AWS ALB
resources.description: View and monitor the primary metrics of Application Load Balancers.

markdown.markdownText:
**AWS ALB**
![Arch_Elastic-Load-Balancing_64.png](data:image/png;base64,)
This AWS ALB Dashboard is part of out of the box Coralogix Extension to provide you with observability for key AWS ALB metrics.

**For integration** : - Please check https://coralogix.com/docs/cloudwatch-metricstreams-kinesis-data-firehose/ OR https://coralogix.com/docs/collect-cloudwatch-metrics-telegraf/

**Use Cases Covered**

* ALB availability % ( Availability below 99 % may already be a sign of service degradation across your platform)
* ALB Request count trends
* Target Connection error trends by Application
* Response Time trends
* Healthy, Unhealthy host
* Healthy, Unhealthy DNS
* Consumed LCUs
* New Connections, Active Connections

More details can be found [here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/application/load-balancer-cloudwatch-metrics.html#load-balancer-metrics-alb=)

widgets.title: ALB Availability % ( Last reported)
widgets.description: This helps in identifying availability.

promqlQuery.value:
(
    100 *
    ( 
    sum(sum_over_time(amazonaws_com_AWS_ApplicationELB_RequestCount_sum{Namespace="AWS/ApplicationELB", cloud_account_id=~"{{account_id}}", cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}",Name=~"{{Name}}",AvailabilityZone!~"",TargetGroup=~"{{TargetGroup}}",LoadBalancer=~"{{LoadBalancer}}"}[${__range}])) - (sum(sum_over_time(amazonaws_com_AWS_ApplicationELB_HTTPCode_ELB_5XX_Count_sum{Namespace="AWS/ApplicationELB", cloud_account_id=~"{{account_id}}", cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}",Name=~"{{Name}}", AvailabilityZone!~"",TargetGroup=~"{{TargetGroup}}",LoadBalancer=~"{{LoadBalancer}}"}[${__range}])) or vector(0)) - (sum(sum_over_time(amazonaws_com_AWS_ApplicationELB_HTTPCode_Target_5XX_Count_sum{Namespace="AWS/ApplicationELB",cloud_account_id=~"{{account_id}}", cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}",Name=~"{{Name}}" ,AvailabilityZone!~"",TargetGroup=~"{{TargetGroup}}",LoadBalancer=~"{{LoadBalancer}}"}[${__range}])) or vector(0))
    ) /
    sum(sum_over_time(amazonaws_com_AWS_ApplicationELB_RequestCount_sum{Namespace="AWS/ApplicationELB", cloud_account_id=~"{{account_id}}", cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}",Name=~"{{Name}}", AvailabilityZone!~"",TargetGroup=~"{{TargetGroup}}",LoadBalancer=~"{{LoadBalancer}}"}[${__range}]))
) OR vector(0)

(
    100 *
    ( 
    sum(sum_over_time(amazonaws_com_AWS_ApplicationELB_RequestCount_sum{Namespace="AWS/ApplicationELB", cloud_account_id=~"{{account_id}}", cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}",Name=~"{{Name}}",AvailabilityZone!~"",TargetGroup=~"{{TargetGroup}}",LoadBalancer=~"{{LoadBalancer}}"}[1m])) - (sum(sum_over_time(amazonaws_com_AWS_ApplicationELB_HTTPCode_ELB_5XX_Count_sum{Namespace="AWS/ApplicationELB", cloud_account_id=~"{{account_id}}", cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}",Name=~"{{Name}}", AvailabilityZone!~"",TargetGroup=~"{{TargetGroup}}",LoadBalancer=~"{{LoadBalancer}}"}[1m])) or vector(0)) - (sum(sum_over_time(amazonaws_com_AWS_ApplicationELB_HTTPCode_Target_5XX_Count_sum{Namespace="AWS/ApplicationELB",cloud_account_id=~"{{account_id}}", cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}",Name=~"{{Name}}" ,AvailabilityZone!~"",TargetGroup=~"{{TargetGroup}}",LoadBalancer=~"{{LoadBalancer}}"}[1m])) or vector(0))
    ) /
    sum(sum_over_time(amazonaws_com_AWS_ApplicationELB_RequestCount_sum{Namespace="AWS/ApplicationELB", cloud_account_id=~"{{account_id}}", cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}",Name=~"{{Name}}", AvailabilityZone!~"",TargetGroup=~"{{TargetGroup}}",LoadBalancer=~"{{LoadBalancer}}"}[1m]))
) OR vector(0)

resources.name: Kubernetes Complete Observability - Coralogix Helmchart Supported
resources.description: View of key metrics relating to the health and performance of Kubernetes.

markdown.markdownText:
![image.png](data:image/png;base64,)

### Kubernetes Complete Observability {Coralogix Helm Chart supported}

This customizable dashboard provides comprehensive insights and real-time monitoring of your Kubernetes clusters, offering unparalleled visibility into the health and performance of your workloads and nodes. This dashboard tracks key metrics such as resource utilization, pod status, node availability, and network traffic to ensure optimal Kubernetes performance and reliability.

**Benefits:**
Improved Resource Management: Proactive monitoring helps optimize the allocation of CPU, memory, and disk resources across nodes and pods, ensuring efficient utilization and performance.
Enhanced Cluster Health: Early detection of potential issues minimizes downtime and ensures that nodes and pods remain healthy and responsive.
Optimized Costs: Gain insights into resource utilization and cluster scaling to avoid unnecessary resource consumption and reduce operational costs.
**Details of integration to bring in Kubernetes Observability Dashboard** - [Kubernetes Complete Observability: Basic Configuration](https://coralogix.com/docs/opentelemetry/kubernetes-observability/kubernetes-complete-observability-basic-configuration/)

### Use Cases Covered

* **Cluster Overview**: Monitor key metrics like node count, pod count, and cluster health to get a comprehensive view of your Kubernetes environment's current state.
* **Resource Utilization**: Track CPU, memory, and disk usage across nodes and pods to ensure efficient resource allocation and prevent bottlenecks or over-provisioning.
* **Node Health Monitoring**: Keep track of node status and readiness to ensure optimal availability and performance of your Kubernetes cluster.
* **Pod Lifecycle**: Monitor pod creation, deletion, and error states to ensure workloads are running as expected and to troubleshoot issues quickly.
* **Network Traffic**: Analyze network traffic and packet flow between nodes, services, and external endpoints to identify potential network issues and ensure proper connectivity.
* **Application Performance**: Monitor the performance of applications deployed in Kubernetes, ensuring they meet operational standards and service level agreements.
* **Container Metrics**: Gain insights into the status of containers, including resource utilization and error rates, to ensure containers are performing optimally.

You can duplicate dashboard  to create a custom K8sObservability journey suitable to your needs.

widgets.title: Container Memory Usage - % Used vs Limit
Latest Pods Not Running by Cluster/Namespace (Pending Pods)
Latest Pods Not Running by Cluster/Namespace (Failed/Unhealthy Pods)
Memory Used By Pod And Container
Max Cpu Cores Requested By Container
Memory Major Page Faults Per Pod

promqlQuery.value: sum by (k8s_cluster_name,k8s_namespace_name,k8s_node_name)(count(k8s_pod_phase_1{k8s_cluster_name_1=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}",k8s_node_name=~"{{k8s_node_name}}"}[${__range}] == 4) by (k8s_cluster_name,k8s_namespace_name,k8s_node_name)) OR on() vector(0)

resources.name: Kubernetes Dashboard - Legacy - KSM, cAdvisor,nodemetrics Supported
resources.description: View of key metrics relating to the health and performance of Kubernetes.Please note that alerts in this package are limited to support for coralogix helm chart only & not nodemetrics,ksm or cAdvisor

markdown.markdownText:
![image.png](data:image/png;base64,)

### Kubernetes Observability Dashboard

This customizable dashboard provides comprehensive insights and real-time monitoring of your Kubernetes clusters, offering unparalleled visibility into the health and performance of your workloads and nodes. This dashboard tracks key metrics such as resource utilization, pod status, node availability, and network traffic to ensure optimal Kubernetes performance and reliability.

Benefits:
Improved Resource Management: Proactive monitoring helps optimize the allocation of CPU, memory, and disk resources across nodes and pods, ensuring efficient utilization and performance.
Enhanced Cluster Health: Early detection of potential issues minimizes downtime and ensures that nodes and pods remain healthy and responsive.
Optimized Costs: Gain insights into resource utilization and cluster scaling to avoid unnecessary resource consumption and reduce operational costs.
Streamlined Operations: Centralized monitoring simplifies cluster management, facilitating quick identification of issues and improving operational efficiency.
Comprehensive Overview: This dashboard ensures effective management and optimization of Kubernetes environments, enhancing performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency.

**Note:** Make sure that kube-state-metrics are properly configured and successfully sent to your Coralogix Account for monitoring and analysis.

### Use Cases Covered

* **Cluster Overview**: Monitor key metrics like node count, pod count, and cluster health to get a comprehensive view of your Kubernetes environment's current state.
* **Resource Utilization**: Track CPU, memory, and disk usage across nodes and pods to ensure efficient resource allocation and prevent bottlenecks or over-provisioning.
* **Node Health Monitoring**: Keep track of node status and readiness to ensure optimal availability and performance of your Kubernetes cluster.
* **Pod Lifecycle**: Monitor pod creation, deletion, and error states to ensure workloads are running as expected and to troubleshoot issues quickly.
* **Network Traffic**: Analyze network traffic and packet flow between nodes, services, and external endpoints to identify potential network issues and ensure proper connectivity.


You can modify the widgets by clicking on the widget you want to customize and editing the query in the bottom query bar to tailor the monitoring system to your specific needs.

promqlQuery.value: count(kube_node_info{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}"}) by (k8s_cluster_name, node, kubelet_version, container_runtime_version)
sum by (pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
avg by (pod) (rate(container_memory_working_set_bytes{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
sum by (pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
avg by (pod) (rate(container_memory_usage_bytes{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
sum by (pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
sum by (pod) (rate(container_memory_usage_bytes{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
avg by (pod) (rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
avg by (pod) (increase({__name__=~"container_network_.+_errors_total",k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
count(count by (pod, k8s_cluster_name) (kube_pod_container_status_running{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}"})) by (k8s_cluster_name) or on() vector(0)

widgets.title: No Logs
widgets.description: Shows NULL if no logs for any of 6 hours

dataprimeQuery.text:
source logs last 7d | distinct $l.applicationname as app| create t from roundTime($p.timeRange.startTime, 6h) 
| explode [t + 6h, t + 12h, t + 18h,  t + 24h]  into hour original preserve
| join (
   source logs 
  | groupby $l.applicationname as app, roundTime($m.timestamp, 6h) as hour  agg count() as log_count
) using app, hour into $d.joined
| choose app, hour, if(joined.log_count == null, 'NO LOGS', 'LOGS') as missing_logs, joined.log_count 
| orderby  joined.log_count ==null  desc

resources.name: MySQL
resources.description: View and monitor the primary metrics of MySQL.

markdown.markdownText:
![MySQL](https://www.vectorlogo.zone/logos/mysql/mysql-official.svg)


MySQL is an open-source, fully managed relational database management system (RDBMS) that provides a reliable and scalable solution for storing and managing structured data. It is designed to help you efficiently manage data, support transactions, and deliver high-performance queries to meet your business and operational needs.

This dashboard is part of the out-of-box MySQL extension providing visibility to and alerting on key performance metrics.

<strong>Details of integrations to bring in MySQL metrics  [here](https://coralogix.com/docs/cloudwatch-metricstreams-kinesis-data-firehose/)

**Use Cases Covered** * Mysql Connections Failed/Success/Max * Running/Connected/Cached threads * Data reads/writes * Slow queries Count * System Load/memory * CPU usage * Network traffic * I/O wait % * MySQL fsync operation counts - Number of times the `fsync` system call is invoked to flush data to disk
**More about monitoring of MySQL** [here](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.4/en/sys-metrics.html)

widgets.title: MySQL FSYNC Op Count Per Sec

widgets.title: Sampled Traces
widgets.description: The amount of sampled traces

widgets.title: Traces Dropped Too Early
widgets.description: Number of Traces Dropped per second, before policy evaluation due to circular buffer overflow

markdown.markdownText:
# Tail Sampling Circular buffer

A circular buffer is used to ensure the number of traces in-memory doesn't exceed `num_traces`.

When a new trace arrives, the oldest trace is removed. 
This can cause a trace to be dropped before tail sampling policy is evaluated. 

To reduce the chance of this happening, increase `num_traces` or decrease `decision_wait`. Both of those options increase memory usage.

widgets.title: Policy Evaluation Errors
widgets.description: Policy Evaluation errors indicate misconfiguration, Check the logs for more details.

widgets.title: Policy Evaluation Latency
widgets.description: Should be below 1s

markdown.markdownText:
# Tail Sampling Policy Evaluation
**Policy Evaluation Errors** - indicate misconfigured Tail Sampling policy, check the Collector logs for more information.

**Policy Evaluation latency** measures sampling a batch of traces and passing sampled traces through the remainder of the collector pipeline.

 A latency exceeding **1 second** can delay sampling decisions beyond `decision_wait`, increasing the chance of traces being dropped before sampling.

resources.name: Synthetic Monitoring
resources.description: View of the url's availability and the state of the particular url .

markdown.markdownText:
##### Synthetic monitoring for URLs is a technique that uses automated, simulated requests to specific web addresses (URLs) to evaluate their performance, availability, and reliability. This proactive approach ensures that web services are functioning as expected from various locations and under different conditions.
##### This Dashboard provides and overall view of the url's availability and the state of the particular url. 
##### For integration details of how synthetics monitoring is done in Coralogix, Click [here](https://coralogix.com/docs/user-guides/monitoring-and-insights/synthetic-monitoring/synthetic-monitoring-with-telegraf/#support)

###### Metrics Used

* http\_response\_http\_response\_code - (metric captures the HTTP status code returned by the server in response to the synthetic HTTP request)
* http\_response\_response\_time - (the total time taken to receive a response to the HTTP request)
* http\_response\_result\_code - (the overall result of the synthetic check, including factors beyond just the HTTP response code. Value 0 represents success and any other value represents dns failure or other results)

###### Use Cases Covered

* Synthetics URL Availability 
* Synthetics URL Failure 
* Synthetics Availability And Failure % Over Time 
* Status Codes Over Time By Host 
* Result Codes
* Latest Synthetic Result Codes
* Synthetic Url Result Code Not Success By Url
* Average Duration By Url

widgets.title: Synthetic Availability And Failure % over time
Status Codes Over Time By Host
Synthetic Url Result Code Not Success
Synthetic Url Result Code Not Success By Url

resources.name: System Monitoring - Otel
resources.description: View and monitor the primary metrics of Host health and CPU, Memory, Disk and Network usage.

markdown.markdownText:
* **CPU/Memory/Disk Utilization Thresholds:**
    * 0% - 70% → 🟢 Normal
    * 70% - 90% → 🟠 Warning
    * Above 90% → 🔴 Critical

**Note: Threshold values are configurable.**

promqlQuery.value: 100 * (sum(sum_over_time(windows_os_virtual_memory_bytes{host_name=~"{{host_name}}",cloud_provider=~"{{cloud_provider}}",cloud_account_id=~"{{cloud_account_id}}",cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}"}[1m])) by (host_name) - sum(sum_over_time(windows_os_virtual_memory_free_bytes{host_name=~"{{host_name}}",cloud_provider=~"{{cloud_provider}}",cloud_account_id=~"{{cloud_account_id}}",cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}"}[1m])) by (host_name)) / sum(sum_over_time(windows_os_virtual_memory_bytes{host_name=~"{{host_name}}",cloud_provider=~"{{cloud_provider}}",cloud_account_id=~"{{cloud_account_id}}",cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}"}[1m])) by (host_name) or on() vector(0)

100 * (sum(sum_over_time(windows_os_virtual_memory_bytes{host_name=~"{{host_name}}",cloud_provider=~"{{cloud_provider}}",cloud_account_id=~"{{cloud_account_id}}",cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}"}[1m])) by (host_name) - sum(sum_over_time(windows_os_virtual_memory_free_bytes{host_name=~"{{host_name}}",cloud_provider=~"{{cloud_provider}}",cloud_account_id=~"{{cloud_account_id}}",cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}"}[1m])) by (host_name)) / sum(sum_over_time(windows_os_virtual_memory_bytes{host_name=~"{{host_name}}",cloud_provider=~"{{cloud_provider}}",cloud_account_id=~"{{cloud_account_id}}",cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}"}[1m])) by (host_name) or on() vector(0)

sum(sum_over_time(windows_logical_disk_size_bytes{host_name=~"{{host_name}}",cloud_provider=~"{{cloud_provider}}",cloud_account_id=~"{{cloud_account_id}}",cloud_region=~"{{cloud_region}}"}[1m])) by (volume,host_name) -sum(sum_over_time(windows_logical_disk_free_bytes{host_name=~"{{host_name}}"}[1m])) by (volume, host_name) or on() vector(0) or on() vector(0)
